column2: A synthetic rubber is any artificial elastomer. They are polymers synthesized from petroleum byproducts.
A synthetic rubber is any artificial elastomer. They are polymers synthesized from petroleum byproducts.
A bank is a financial institution that accepts deposits from the public and creates a demand deposit while simultaneously making loans.
A financial institution that conducts underwriting, loan services, financial advising, and fundraising services for large corporations and high-net-worth individuals.

An exchange where stockbrokers and traders can buy and sell securities, such as shares of stock, bonds, and other financial instruments. Stock exchanges may also provide facilities for the issue and redemption of such securities and instruments and capital events including the payment of income and dividends.
